body: Traditionally (with quotes around that), some Iterator implementations will throw `ConcurrentModificationException` should the underlying collection change between construction time and a given invocation of `next()`. To have this iterator do that would be a bit of a hugger-ma-rug; so i'd vote for noting its absence in javadocs and moving on. Should this functionality become a demand for prime-time, we could go back and add functionality to allow such detection and a subsequent throw.
